sub_title: Software Implementation Consultant/Power BI expert at Cost Engineering || Empowering organizations to improve their project performance
summary:
Enthusiastic, result-oriented and hard worker with strong social and communication skills and a passion for new (international) experiences.

Currently consultant at Cost Engineering: implementing the in-house developed software Cleopatra Enterprise at our clients in various industries like oil and gas, renewables, on- & offshore chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and energy.
Therefore, being the connecting key between the business and IT and working closely together with clients during an implementation project.

Finished the master Chemical Engineering at the TU Delft with major process technology and minors food technology and finance.

education.field_of_study: Nature, Science and Technology and Economics

awards.title: Topsector Chemistry Grant
awards.description: The Association of the Dutch Chemical Industry (VNCI) promotes the collective interests of the chemical industry in the Netherlands by means of consultations, information meetings and recommendations. The VNCI acts on behalf of the entire sector as a central contact point and undertakes activities that have a positive impact on the image of the chemical industry. The Topsector Chemistry Grant is awarded to chemical (engineering) students who will join the chemistry top talents community, which exists of companies, universities and the VNCI. I got a two year grant from Rutgers Resins B.V. (Rain Carbon) in exchange for an internship at this company. For more information: https://www.vnci.nl/topsector-chemiebeurs
awards.issuer: Vereniging van de Nederlandse Chemische Industrie (VNCI)

certifications.name: Successful participation Netherlands-Asia Honours Summer School

projects.title: Consultancy Project Avalex
projects.description:
Two weeks before we departure to the destinations of the Foreign Excursion Tour 2016, a case is solved by four chemical engineering students for the company Avalex. 
Avalex is responsible for the collection and treatment of waste in the area of Delft and is wondering: what is the best way to treat plastic? At the moment discussions are going on about the most sustainable and /or cost-efficient ways of recycling plastics, especially as oil prices are so low. The price is certainly affected, but Avalex focuses mainly on sustainability. Therefore, they want that four students figure out the most sustainable way of plastic processing. Two options are available. First, plastic can be used as input for an AVI and converted to and second plastic can be used as input for a methanol plant.

projects.title: Conceptual Design Project Paques BV
projects.description: The bio-based, biodegradable polymer, polyhydroxybutyrate-co-valerate (PHBV) can be produced from organic waste streams using microbial enrichment cultures that convert simple organic acids into valuable polymers. The final bottleneck in the process is the extraction of the polymers from the bacterial biomass, therefore a potentially viable extraction process needs to be developed and Paques BV asked a team of six chemical engineering students for this. In this team I was responsible for the organisation, planning and contact with the stakeholder management. We designed a full scale (5 kt/y) extraction process based on knowledge from lab-scale experimental data and specified relevant unit operations, mass balances and estimated process costs by use of process modelling tool Aspen.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for Cleopatra Enterprise implementation projects (small to large) at various clients around the world executed by teams of 5 to 10 members.

Involved in complete process; from first contact with clients to long-term partnerships after finalisation of the implementation.

profile_positions.title: Lead Implementation Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Implementing the in-house developed software Cleopatra Enterprise at our clients in various industries like oil and gas, on- & offshore chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and energy.
Therefore, being the connecting key between the business and IT and working closely together with the client during an implementation project. 

Each implementation project starts with a needs assessments workshop to investigate the needs of the client and develop their (new) cost engineering work process and demonstrating the features of the software. This is followed by the implementation itself; adjustment of the software to meet the defined requirements and train the client in the developed cost engineering work process. 

As part of this role, participating in branch specific certification programs, training courses and internal courses.

profile_positions.description: Project via Altran: support and development working procedures IT-automation department.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Base Business

profile_positions.description: As project & service manager I ensured that the quality of the IT-services provided by Altran is guaranteed and continuously improved, partly through SLAs (Service Level Agreements). I was responsible for the relationship with a portfolio of clients: dealing problems at the customer, managing engineers and programmers by use of PRINCE2, making an inventory of customer needs and translate these into technical solutions. Furthermore, I performed administrative tasks such as invoicing, writing proposals and project estimations.
profile_positions.title: Project & Service Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: As a mentor of a refugee student I helped my mentee with his courses at tuniversity, the Dutch language and finding a part time job. Besides, we learned about each other's culture and visions during social activities. It was very interesting and inspiring for me and resulted in a good friendship between the two of us.
